org.bsiet.layouts

Class MyLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.bsiet.layouts.MyLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class MyLayout
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    The Java Wizard Development Team

    Use

    This class allows you to manage your components in HORIZONTAL and VERTICAL group's of GroupLayout.
    It You just have to pass your Components in proper sequence in which you want in the Object's array.
    That Object's array then you should have to insert in MyLayout's Object as specified in sample.
    You'll get the output as all Components in array arranged in Single JPanel arranged by GroupLayout with their PREFERRED_SIZE.
    There is limitation as you can pass maximum upto 15 Components for one Object but if you need more then you can manage it through multiple Objects(in multiple JPanel's)

    Sample Code


    LabelledText tx1;
    LabelledPaswordField tx2;
    JButton b1, b2;
    tx1 = new LabelledText("Username", 10);
    tx2 = new LabelledPasswordField("Password", 10);
    b1 = new JButton("Login");
    b2 = new JButton("Cancel");

    MyLayout layout1 = new MyLayout(new Object[]{tx1, tx2}, true);
    MyLayout layout2 = new MyLayout(new Object[]{b1, b2}, false);
    MyLayout layout3 = new MyLayout(new Object[]{layout1, layout2}, true);
    add(layout3);
    Here we've created for 2 Components but you can do from 1 to 15 Components.
    In above code layout1 will have two vertically aligned components that are LabelledText and LabelledPasswordField respectfully.
    Then we've collected two button in horizontal group in layout2
    Now we've collected layout1 and layout2 to form Structure like login form having Components aligned vertically in layout3.
    Now we add layout3 and we get the exact login form as we always expect in general manner.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyLayout

        public MyLayout(java.lang.Object[] arr,
        boolean isVertical)
        Instantiates a new MyLayout with specified number of Components in specified orientation - either VERTICAL or HORIZONTAL referred by boolean isVertical.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array of the Component's as an Object[]
        isVertical - - Aligns the components in array either in VERTICAL or in HORIZONTAL manner as specified through isVertical.
           true - Aligns all specified components in VERTICAL sequential group.
           false - Aligns all specified components in HORIZONTAL sequential group.
        Since:
        1.7
